page.title: 16Bedlormie House, Blackridge
page.content: {Bedlormie House}is one of the oldest inhabited houses in Scotland. It is surrounded by trees and fields. The people who live there own{32 acres of land. It is about 1 mile out of Blackridge. We call it the{White {Gates}because the gates at the entrance are white. Bedlormie House is supposed to have a{secret passage which runs from Bedlormie House to Bedlormie Farm, although people say that it runs from Bedlormie House to Westcraigs. It was said that{Bonnie {Prince Charlie}used the passage to escape from his enemies. Bonnie Prince Charlie was given hospitality at Bedlormie and entertained there as well. It has 9 main rooms, 1 cloakroom, 2 bathrooms, 1 kitchen, 1 butlers pantry. There is supposed to be a{ghost}in Bedlormie House.
